scenarios.abuse_path: Inputs attempt to override guardrails (e.g., ‘ignore rules’, ‘act as developer’, hidden instructions).
containment: Fail-closed: refuse disallowed actions; provide safe alternatives.
Route sensitive actions through a strict allowlist of safe operations.
detection: Detect instruction-conflict patterns (‘ignore previous’, ‘system prompt’, ‘developer override’).
Flag high-risk intent + policy boundary keywords; require explicit safe reframing.
scenarios.name: Prompt Injection / Policy Override Attempts
recovery: Log the event (non-sensitive summary) for audit trail + trend detection.
If repeated, increase strictness: reduce tool access surface + require human confirmation where applicable.

scenarios.abuse_path: User asks for keys, private files, internal configs, or tries to get the system to reveal hidden content.
containment: Never disclose secrets; minimize data; redact paths/identifiers if logged.
Constrain outputs to user-provided content + explicitly permitted artifacts only.
detection: Detect requests for credentials, private keys, secrets, hidden prompts, personal data.
Detect attempts to make the assistant ‘summarize’ or ‘print’ private tool outputs.
scenarios.name: Data Exfiltration / Secret-Harvesting Attempts
recovery: Rotate/revoke any suspected exposed secrets (human action), then re-seal epoch/head if required.
Add regression tests for any leakage pattern that was observed.

scenarios.abuse_path: Scoring is used to justify unfair targeting, discrimination, or punitive actions.
containment: Require contextual disclaimers + limitations in high-stakes contexts.
Enforce policy: deny requests that aim to harm or unfairly discriminate.
detection: Detect high-stakes usage context (employment, housing, policing, medical, legal).
Detect language framing the score as ‘truth’ rather than a tool with limits.
scenarios.name: Misuse of Governance Scoring for Harmful Decisions
recovery: Record misuse attempt type (non-identifying) to improve safeguards.
Add policy tests to ensure refusal behavior stays stable across versions.

scenarios.abuse_path: Attacker claims to be admin/CEO/dev, uses urgency to bypass process (‘do it now, no checks’).
containment: Enforce invariant workflow: commit → seal → verify → pytest → push (no exceptions).
Require reproducible evidence (logs/outputs) before taking sensitive actions.
detection: Detect urgency/coercion patterns (‘right now’, ‘no time’, ‘don’t verify’).
Detect authority impersonation claims and pressure tactics.
scenarios.name: Social Engineering via ‘Authority’ or Urgency
recovery: If bypass occurred, roll back to last sealed good head and rerun D1–D4.
Add/strengthen gates (like gate_change.sh) to make bypass mechanically difficult.
